ENGLISH AB INITIO – STANDARD LEVEL – PAPER 1
ANGLAIS AB INITIO – NIVEAU Moyen – épreuve 1
INGLÉS AB INITIO – NIVEL MEDIO – PRUEBA 1

Monday 12 November 2012 (afternoon)                                      Candidate session number
Lundi 12 novembre 2012 (après-midi)                                    Numéro de session du candidat
Lunes 12 de noviembre de 2012 (tarde)                                Número de convocatoria del alumno

                                                                 0     0
1 h 30 m


QUESTION AND ANSWER BOOKLET – INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES
•   Write your session number in the boxes above.
•   Do not open this booklet until instructed to do so.
•   This booklet contains all the Paper 1 questions (Text handling and written response).
•   Refer to the Text Booklet which accompanies this booklet.
•   Answer all of the questions in the spaces provided.
•   Each text handling question is allocated [1 mark] unless otherwise stated.
•   The written response is allocated [10 marks].
•   The maximum mark for this examination paper is [50 marks].


LIVRET DE QUESTIONS ET RÉPONSES – INSTRUCTIONS DESTINÉES AUX CANDIDATS
•   Écrivez votre numéro de session dans la case ci-dessus.
•   N’ouvrez pas ce livret avant d’y être autorisé(e).
•   Ce livret contient toutes les questions de l’Épreuve 1 (lecture interactive et réponse écrite).
•   Référez-vous au livret de textes qui accompagne ce livret.
•   Répondez à toutes les questions dans l’espace réservé à cet effet.
•   Sauf indication contraire, chaque question de lecture interactive vaut [1 point].
•   La réponse écrite vaut [10 points].
•   Le nombre maximum de points pour cette épreuve d’examen est [50 points].


CUADERNO DE PREGUNTAS Y RESPUESTAS – INSTRUCCIONES PARA LOS ALUMNOS
•   Escriba su número de convocatoria en las casillas de arriba.
•   No abra este cuaderno hasta que se lo autoricen.
•   Este cuaderno contiene todas las preguntas de la Prueba 1 (Manejo de textos y respuesta escrita).
•   Refiérase al cuaderno de textos que acompaña a este cuaderno.
•   Conteste todas las preguntas usando los espacios provistos.
•   Cada pregunta de manejo de textos tiene valor de [1 punto] salvo que se indique algo distinto.
•   La respuesta escrita tiene un valor de [10 puntos].
•   La puntuación máxima para esta prueba de examen es [50 puntos].

TEXT A — SCHOOL FACTS

1.    Eight of the following sentences are true.  Write the letters corresponding to the correct answers in
      the boxes provided.  Base your answer on Text A.  An example has been given.                [8 marks]


      A.    Rose Gilbert is a teacher.                                              Example:     A

      B.    Rose Gilbert is the great great grandmother of one of her pupils.

      C.    Rose Gilbert is rich.

      D.    Rose Gilbert does not want to stop work.

      E.    Babar Ali is a hard-working pupil.

      F.    Babar Ali looks after his family’s garden.

      G.    Babar Ali makes sure pupils go to school.

      H.    Sparky cannot hear.

      I.    Sparky abandoned his family.

      J.    Sparky understands some sign language.

      K.    Several students have graduated with a degree in “The Beatles,
            Popular Music and Society”.

      L.    Mary-Lu Kennedy wrote an article in a newspaper about
            The Beatles’ music.

      M.    Mary-Lu Kennedy thinks that her university course is not useful.

      N.    The smallest school in the world has one classroom.

      O.    Twelve students attend the smallest school.

      P.    People send presents to the smallest school.




8812-2843

                                         0208
                                                                              –3–                         N12/2/ANENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

TEXT B — CAIRNGORM CHALLENGE

Answer the following questions. Base your answers on Part .

2.    In which two activities will the participants in the Cairngorm Challenge take part?

      (a)      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

      (b)      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

3.    Which word means “an exciting experience”?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

4.    Who will receive a medal?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

5.    Name two kinds of meals which the participants will have.

      (a)      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

      (b)      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .


Match the titles on the right with the missing titles in Part  of the text. Write the letter in the box provided.
An example has been given. Note: there are more titles than you need.


Example: Title [ – X – ]               C              A.       Challenges for people of all levels of fitness
                                                      B.       Fantastic location
6.    Title [ – 1 – ]
                                                      C.       Great team challenge
7.    Title [ – 2 – ]                                 D.       A family holiday
                                                      E.       The prizes
8.    Title [ – 3 – ]
                                                      F.       Rare opportunity to visit the Cairngorms
9.    Title [ – 4 – ]
                                                      G.       Change the lives of young people in need of help
                                                      H.       See the animals!
                                                      I.       Children can participate in the Cairngorm Challenge!

Answer the following questions. Base your answers on lines 9–29.

10.   Which word means “animals” and “birds”?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

11.   Why do big events not take place frequently in the park?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

12.   Why is it an advantage to be in a team?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

13.   Which is the best route for someone who is not very fit?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .


Match the beginnings of the sentences on the left with the ends of the sentences on the right. Write the letter
in the box provided. Base your answers on lines 30–40. An example has been given. Note: there are more
endings than you need.


Example: If you participate in the Cairngorm                                              A.       who gives money to help children in need.
		       Challenge …			 C
                                                                                          B.       she had no family to help her.
14.   Heather is an example of someone …                                                  C.       you will also help other people.
                                                                                          D.       she could not take part in the challenge.
15.   Heather was in need of support because …
                                                                                          E.       who was helped by the Cairngorm  
                                                                                                   Challenge.



Answer the following questions. Base your answers on lines 30–40.

16.   Which word in the text means “young people”?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

17.   Which word in the text means “a place to live”?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

TEXT C — MARTIN LUTHER KING CELEBRATION: A DAY OF SERVICE

The sentences below are either true or false. Tick [] the correct answer. Justify your answer by only
using words from the text. Both parts are required for [1 mark]. Base your answers on lines 1–14.
An example has been given.

                                                                                                                                        True        False
Example: According to Martin Luther King if you serve your community,
                                                                                                                                           
         you are great.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . Everybody can be great … because anybody can serve. . . . . . . . . . . . .

18.   This is the first time the Martin Luther King Day has been celebrated as a
      national holiday.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

19.   Martin Luther King was against violence.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

20.   During the celebration there will be a show.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

21.   The purpose of the meeting at the Kauai Grove Centre is to encourage people to
      help others.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

22.   Ten volunteer groups will be present at the Kauai Grove Centre meeting.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

23.   People can give clothes to help the poor.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




8812-2843                                                                               Turn over / Tournez la page / Véase al dorso

Complete the table below. Base your answers on lines 1–14. An example has been given.


             In the sentence …                  the word …                         refers to …

Example: Martin Luther King said that
         he wanted to be remembered …               he       . . . . . . . . . Martin Luther King. . . . . . . . 
         (line 5)
24.    … to take action in their communities.
                                                   their     . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
       (line 11)
25.    A dozen volunteer organizations will
                                                  there      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
       be there … (lines 11–12)

26.    … who cannot volunteer … (line 13)          who       . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

27.    … can still contribute to it …
                                                    it       . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
       (line 13)


The words in the left-hand column are taken from lines 15–22 of the text. Find the word in the
right-hand column which is closest in meaning to one of the words on the left. Write the letter in the
box provided. An example has been given. Note: there are more words than you need.


Example: moving (line 15)           F      A.   changing
                                           B.   start
28.   mix (line 16)		
                                           C.   include
29.   open (line 19)                       D.   group
30.   greeting (line 19)                   E.   supporting
                                           F.   touching
31.   helping (line 21)
                                           G.   variety
                                           H.   welcome

TEXT D — MAKE THE MOST OF THE WEEKEND

Choose the most appropriate response from the options below. Write the letter in the box provided.

32.   The main subject of this article is …
      A.    activities for everyone on the weekend.
      B.    activities with the family on the weekend.
      C.    weekend activities at home.
      D.    weekend sports activities for youth.


Choose the most appropriate response from the options below. Base your answer on part  of the text.
Write the letter in the box provided.

33.   Which reason for playing sport is not given in the text?
      A.    You will be in better health.
      B.    You will become a better player.
      C.    You will become a professional sports player.
      D.    You will meet people you like.

                                                            WRITTEN RESPONSE

Complete the following task. Include all the relevant details that you can find using only the information in
Text D. Write at least 40 words. Do not copy out large sections of the text.

34.   You live on the island of Fiji and you send an e-mail to your English friend to tell him/her about the
      interesting things you have done this weekend on the island.  You mention at least nine activities.

                 Attention:		


                                                                                                                               NORMAL

          Subject:   A great weekend!




               Dear Karin,
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
               Hope to see you soon  .. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
